decks.notes: This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and casting powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Lotus Petal to accelerate mana production, allowing for early plays of intimidating Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End. Chalice of the Void and Wasteland provide disruption against opposing strategies, while cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Glaring Fleshraker offer additional threats to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifact combos to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage, allowing for explosive plays and quick victories. By assembling key pieces like Mystic Forge, Grim Monolith, and Basalt Monolith, the deck can generate infinite mana loops, which can be used to cast powerful spells like The One Ring. With support cards like City of Traitors and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly ramp up its resources and overwhelm opponents with a variety of game-winning threats and combos.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast a powerful storm combo. The pilot can use cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to search for key spells like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to finish off the opponent in a single turn. In addition to disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, the deck can also benefit from card draw and manipulation through Ponder, Brainstorm, and Vexing Bauble. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. By utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal like Fatal Push, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and disruption, while cards like Thoughtseize and Brainstorm help dig for the key pieces needed to win the game. With a mix of tempo plays and card advantage, this deck aims to maintain control of the game while applying pressure to secure victory.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Mox Diamond, the deck can ramp up its mana production to play threats ahead of schedule. Cards like It That Heralds the End, Thought-Knot Seer, and Glaring Fleshraker provide powerful creatures that can disrupt the opponent's strategy and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn to control the board and protect its creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo as quickly as possible to mill opponents' libraries. The deck includes cards like Goblin Engineer to tutor for key pieces, along with disruption and protection spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. The deck also includes accelerants like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to speed up the combo. Additionally, cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and The One Ring provide alternate win conditions to complement the main combo.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a devastating combo. It also includes disruptors like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, along with mana denial cards like Wasteland to slow down opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with high-powered creatures and disrupt their game plan to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Swords to Plowshares, Skyclave Apparition, and Solitude, the deck can efficiently deal with threats while deploying its own threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Broadside Bombardiers. The addition of cards like Magus of the Moon and Wasteland also allows the deck to punish greedy mana bases. The deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient and powerful threats.
